newsitem.title: UK: TT Club appoints seven new directors.
newsitem.headline: TT Club appoints seven new directors.

text.p: MUTUAL intermodal transport insurer, the TT Club, said Monday it had appointed seven new directors drawn from member companies.
Four are leading figures in the Asia shipping and ports industries, while three have been drawn from major freight forwarders, the TT Club said.
The appointments highlighted "the increased importance of both the freight forwarding industry and the Asia-Pacific region to the TT Club" it said.

Among the high-profile appointments are C.C. Tung, who replaces his brother Tung Chee-hwa, who resigned from as both chairman of Orient Overseas (International) Ltd and a TT Club director ahead of his appointment as chief executive of the Hong Kong special administrative region.
Also from Hong Kong is John Meredith, group managing director of Hutchison Whampoa Ltd subsidiary Hutchison International Port Holdings Ltd which recently joined the TT Club.

Danzas Holding AG director Peter Wagner becomes a TT Club board member, along with freight forwarding industry colleagues Gerard Fischer, chairman and chief executive of Panalpina World Transport and Klaus Herms, managing director of the Asia-Pacific arm of Switzerland's Kuehne & Nagel International AG.
Also joining the TT Club board are Enrique Razon Jr, chairman of International Container Terminal Services Inc, and Ray Miles, president of Canadian Pacific Ltd subsidiary CP Ships.
A TT Club spokesman said directors were elected to the mutual insurer's nearly 30-strong board for fixed terms, but was unable to give details of the latest appointments.
The TT Club is headquartered in Bermuda, with operating centres in London, New Jersey and Hong Kong.
